comments.commentBody: George W. Bush tightened his control under similar circumstances.
Absolutely easi-lee -- Scott Skiles is the #1 key to the Bucks' success.

1. Vladimir Putin's administration is under attack by corruption. Terrorism and corruption walk together in the sands of Russia. Osama Bin Laden has been air dropped into the state of russian affairs. Osama Bin Laden's rein of attack must be stopped.

2. The United State of America and Russia in a joint military operation should seek out and capture the dirty clothes of the Al Qaeda/Taliban/World Crime Syndicate. The world most heinous criminals since the Devil who time has come for Law Enforcement Justice. Osama Bin Laden bares a brown stain on all police hall of fame buildings; all war memorials through out the United States; all uniforms worn by the military, police and security forces; our education systems; all American families and more importantly this is a test of our allegiance (love) of our country. Never before has such an individual played fun at the President of the United States and its people. Osama Bin Laden is a devil that must exercised by military and civil intelligence forces so our own nation is free from the sin of corruption. Organized crime is the ultimate sin of any corporation. We must stay on alert. May God protect the Russian people from the sin of war called the War-On-Terrorism (WOT).

Antonio Ivan Easterling
Chief Editor
The Proletarian Review
Sarcastically speaking, George Bush could have set up a better system in Iraq like the one that kept  in power long after he had become known as utterly incompetent.

Well, this new, best-of-all-possible-worlds war "strategy" is working out great, eh?

Of course, we silly citizens are not supposed to pay attention to complicated realities like the fact that President Karzai and the government of Afghanistan are both permanently corrupt.

No, we're just supposed to get in line and cheer President Obama's war-drum-thumping, permanent-war-promoting speech to our soldiers. To whom he promised the very best care for their coming traumatic brain injuries and life-and-family-destroying PTSD. Yeah. Thanks, buddy!

Oh, we're also supposed to marvel at his leather presidential bomber jacket and how cool that is. Shiny! Fancy! Oooohhhh! It's like he's the president in some cool Hollywood movie!

Troops home now. Not next fall, not next summer, not in 2012. Right now.

I am curious as to Mr. Putin's strategy, sell a hardline government the ability to make nuclear material and possibly weapons, and yet, go to war with the very people they sponsor for independence on "Russian" soil?  How does he hope to win them over?  Or is hoping to let them develop a bomb, and Putin can make the first pre-emptive strike?  He seems to be slowly digging his own grave.

The Chechens evidently are trying to repay what Russians inflicted on them in the last 20 years.

Most likely we'll see more of this coming.

We had the same problem with our puppet, Diem, in Vietnam in 1963. The CIA took care of that, and gosh, didn't that work out well!

We can't seem to get it right in Afghanistan. In 2002 we should have sent EVERYONE there, overwhelming sudden force, total destruction of Al Queda and the Taliban, followed by very, very careful restructuring to make sure Afghanistan never became a nest of terrorists again. Instead, well...we all know what we did instead.

So now here's this bind. Karzai, a fraud from the get-go, is the only horse we've got to back there. It's not going to work out well.

Our options in Afghanistan are all unpalatable. The big push we're currently trying won't accomplish anything without a realistic plan for the aftermath...one with limited goals. What is our vision for Afghanistan when we reach that Lone Ranger moment and pronounce, "Our work here is done"? When do we know we've "won"? In Vietnam the time came when we certainly knew we'd lost. The same time came for the Russians in Afghanistan. So where's the clear definition of success? What do we want to accomplish there? President Obama has said that Afghanistan was the "right" war and Iraq was the "wrong" one. I absolutely agree with him...if it's 2002 again. But what's our clearcut goal in Afghanistan now? And how do we reach it with Karzai in charge? Maybe it's time to call in the CIA...oh, wait...that's where I started this comment.
this is horrible beyond belief! my thoughts are with the Russian people as they deal with yet another tragedy.

Sure, the fact that Karzai now "believes the Americans are in Afghanistan because they want to dominate his country and the region, and that they pose an obstacle to striking a peace deal with the Taliban" is a direct proof that Karzai has lost it (was he listening too much to Al-Jazeera??).  Everyone knows that we're there to promote to peace, prosperity, democracy and freedom. And anyone who thinks otherwise is a lunatic, an enemy or, if on our payroll, an "unreliable ally."

@ Ladislav(#297): I am amazed by how easily American people make judgments about things they know so little about. You keep talking about Putin's KGB past, his decision to appoint governors after the Beslan incident, the Litvinenko case, and that's about it. With that limited knowledge of what is really going on in the country(drawn from the NYT articles, obviously), you think you have the right to just go ahead and advise Russians what to do. I mean, it might be fine, but not with that arrogant "I-know-all-about-Putin-and-Russia" attitude. Plus, Russians are not that stupid. Things are changing, although slowly. Russia cannot be today's China, that's for sure.
also, the prayers are not meant to "do the trick."
Cut off the money, that will get Karzai's attention. If that doesn't do it, pull out completely and let him take his chances with the Taliban.
Re: 289 Pauline in Nizhny, Russia -- Thank *you*, Pauline.  Wishing peace and prosperity to you, and yours ....

Why doesn't our government clean up our corruption before blaming others.   It seems that no one has any respect for our president.  Our govt not condemning the Iranians despot's visit to afghanistan is unbelievable. also how can the times not consider this news. i just read the times to see how biased a paper can be.

This is a stunning piece. Politics in that part of the world, Pak, Afganistan is a venal business. We were wrong to have gotten entangled there.
Best course of action is to leave the region immediately and use drones. tomahawk missiles when we have accurate intelligence against known terror leaders.

However, if they do not attack us, we do not attack them.

American moms and dads will certainly feel just great sending their kids over to Afghanistan to be killed for and "unreliable ally."  This war has only been going on for eight years.  We're busy turning it into another Viet Nam.  Soon to have just under 100,000 troops over there supporting our "unreliable ally."  Good thinking, Mr. Obama.
The Northern Alliance, the people who we have placed in power there, were (and STILL ARE) ALLIES of Iran.  Prior to the Massoud assassination by the Taliban, what was the job of Karzi?

Could it be that God had it right when he wrote the 10 commandments and we were later told that there were really only two?

Love God

Love your Neighbor as yourself. The remaining 8 are really just an extension of the 2ed commandment.

Our world has a long history of strong governments who thought they could guarantee their safety and welfare through overwhelming force. In the end, the suppressed, who had nothing to lose by dieing won the battle.

Consider this; if you were in a life boat with 50 other people, in the middle of the ocean, with limited food, water and medical supplies and no immediate prospects for rescue; how would you expect the available resources (food, water, medical supplies) to be distributed?

Suppose the biggest guy on board or perhaps a little guy with a gun attempted to horde it all; what do you think the outcome would be?

By the same token we would expect everyone to contribute, as best they could to the general welfare.

We might not expect the pregnant women and children to row, but we might ask then to clean fish.

Now zoom out a million miles and what do you see?

Another lifeboat – the planet Earth, circling the sun, with limited resources; in a small solar system somewhere in the Milky Way.

I believe that is that is the way God actually sees us and will eventually judge us. My guess is our end will eventually come when God gives up on his experiment with the human race and creates another.

It's lack of love and freedom, and specially lack of knowledge to live love and freedom. Jesus is the best teacher, but his followers are sinners. We can only pray and forgive to ourselves and to our enemy, all other attempts will fail.

Well Israel is a reliable ally and Obama would rather help Iran build nukes.

If there is anyone in all of this who is unreliable it is Obama.
Just what are America's long tern interests in Afganistan?

It's a crime to knowingly send Americans to die for this guy and his cronies -- not to mention all the deaths of Afghan civilians. The escalation was quite a cynical political gambit by Obama -- they know what Karzai is about. How about using the cash (er, I mean loan from China) and manpower for "homeland security" as well as infrastructure, in the "homeland." I guess with defense contractors in every Congressional district we have to perpetuate wars and inane levels of spending to destroy.

Putin is probably no nonsense on terrorism. Oligarchic fraud? Nyet.
Obama on terrorism???? He'll have to talk with Holder on that. Obama on corporate fraud....
Next question?
Turn the terrorist attack in subway into an attack on Putin?  The Russian government will respond.     More twisting NYT propanganda

Is it possible that Hamid Karzi knows more about us than meet the eyes? Seeing the sausage making of American real politick as our private contractors are running a parallel universe might be telling him something about us which would not be very flattering. Or he might have a better exit strategy than we do. All those strong men in central Asian stans would welcome him with all his money. Even Dubai can use some of his money and let him stay in one of those zillion star hotels which are sitting empty.
Apparently he has lots more options than we do.
